channel.title: Is it possible to make an array like... SomeArray['lala'] := 'blah blah';?
channel.description:
Is it possible to make an array like... SomeArray['lala'] := 'blah blah'; ?
I noticed it's possible in pascal, but when I tried to use the same example script as they did, I received errors. :(
Is there a way to do this in scar?

item.title: Is it possible to make an array like... SomeArray['lala'] := 'blah blah';?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Darn. Thanks any way Kane and everyone else for your work.

I’m just going to download Turbo Pascal lol.

item.title: Is it possible to make an array like... SomeArray['lala'] := 'blah blah';?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Well apart from what Kane said you can always declare 3 or even 4 of one array. (I have no idea why you would do this but: )

var
Test : array[1…2] of array[1…2] of array[1…2] of array[1…2] of integer;

begin
Test[1][1][1][1] := 1337;
end.

Ect.

item.title: Is it possible to make an array like... SomeArray['lala'] := 'blah blah';?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“Weibs, post:6, topic:17625”]Oh, ok. But doesn’t it set the ‘Names’ array length to one more than the given array?

  SetarrayLength(Names, GetarrayLength(a) + 1;

The + 1 would make the Array 1 more than the length of the given array, wouldn’t it?[/quote]
I put that in there because when the “1” wasn’t there the value of Names would go down minus one to the length of the users array.

So x[1] would be Names[0]. I know it didn’t really matter, But i put it in anyway to make it more understandable. With it in, x[1] is Names[1].

Ron, you could make a small include type thing.

This named ArrayNames.scar:
[scar]
var Names: array of String;

procedure ArrayName(a: array of string; i: Integer; s: string);
begin
SetarrayLength(Names, GetarrayLength(a) + 1);
if (GetarrayLength(a) < i) then Exit;
Names[i]:= s;
end;

function Convert(s: string): Integer;
var i: Integer;
begin
for i:= 0 to GetarrayLength(Names)-1 do
begin
if (Lowercase(s) = Lowercase(Names[i])) then
begin
Result:= i;
Exit;
end;
end;
if (Result <= 0) then Result:= GetarrayLength(Names)-(GetarrayLength(Names)-1);
end;
[/scar]

And this your script:

[scar]
{.include ArrayNames.scar}

var x: array [1…2] of String;
begin
x[1]:= ‘Weee!’;
x[2]:= ‘Aww…’;

ArrayName(x, 1, ‘w’);
ArrayName(x, 2, ‘a’);

Writeln(x[Convert(‘w’)]); //Writes Weee!
Writeln(x[Convert(‘a’)]); //Writes Aww…
end.
[/scar]

;)[br][size=1]Posted at: October 09, 2006, 11:37:51 AM[/size][hr]Also, Weibs: It actually dosn’t put one more than the array, but one less.

[scar]
{.include ArrayNames.scar}

var x: array [1…2] of String;
begin
x[1]:= ‘Weee!’;
x[2]:= ‘Aww…’;

ArrayName(x, 1, ‘w’);
ArrayName(x, 2, ‘a’);

Writeln(Names[3]);
end.
[/scar]

Returns:
[Runtime Error] : Out Of Range in line 11 in script C:Documents and SettingsKaneDesktopx.scar

But:
[scar]
{.include ArrayNames.scar}

var x: array [1…2] of String;
begin
x[1]:= ‘Weee!’;
x[2]:= ‘Aww…’;

ArrayName(x, 1, ‘w’);
ArrayName(x, 2, ‘a’);

Writeln(Names[0]);
end.
[/scar]

Just returns Blank. Unless you name it something.

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible to make an array like... SomeArray['lala'] := 'blah blah';?
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Oh, ok. But doesn’t it set the ‘Names’ array length to one more than the given array?

  SetarrayLength(Names, GetarrayLength(a) + 1;

The + 1 would make the Array 1 more than the length of the given array, wouldn’t it?

But thanks for the explanation, lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible to make an array like... SomeArray['lala'] := 'blah blah';?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

Weibs:

WTF KANE! Your sripts are always so complicated, hold on let me read through it for the 3rd time…

haha, let me explain.

It sets the array var “Names” to the same length of the array that the user inputs. Then, it changes the Names array to the text you want.

But when you Convert it it results the Integer.

item.source: Is it possible to make an array like... SomeArray['lala'] := 'blah blah';?

item.title: Is it possible to make an array like... SomeArray['lala'] := 'blah blah';?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

You could try a converting thing?

[scar]
var Names: array of String;

procedure ArrayName(a: array of string; i: Integer; s: string);
begin
SetarrayLength(Names, GetarrayLength(a) + 1);
if (GetarrayLength(a) < i) then Exit;
Names[i]:= s;
end;

function Convert(s: string): Integer;
var i: Integer;
begin
for i:= 0 to GetarrayLength(Names)-1 do
begin
if (Lowercase(s) = Lowercase(Names[i])) then
begin
Result:= i;
Exit;
end;
end;
if (Result <= 0) then Result:= GetarrayLength(Names)-(GetarrayLength(Names)-1);
end;

var x: array [1…10] of string;
var i: Integer;
begin
for i:= 1 to 10 do
begin
x[i]:= Inttostr(Random(20) + 1);
ArrayName(x, i, ‘lala’ + Inttostr(i));
Writeln(Inttostr(i) + ': ’ + x[Convert(‘lala’ + Inttostr(i))]);
end;
end.
[/scar]

Only way of doing it as far as i know.

Read full topic
